intro: Echium pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula and parts of southern France. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium pyrenaicum is often found in open woodlands and alpine meadows, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these regions.
